Column Comment.0: PDEN VOLUME REGIME: unique indicator for a volume regime used for reportingproduction volumes.
Column Comment.1: CONVERSION QUANTITY: A Conversion code for a generic set of conversionfactors (GAS VOL and OIL VOL)
Column Comment.2: CONVERSION OBS NO: An observation number to allow for multiple coversionfactors for different time periods
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: CONVERSION FACTOR: A multiplier to convert from the FROM units of measure tothe TO units of measure
Column Comment.5: CONVERSION FORMULA: A formula referencing an additional product propertyrequired in the conversion (Gas Heat Content, Oil Density)
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.8: FROM UOM: The units of measure that the source data is in.
Column Comment.9: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.10: PREFERRED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this particular conversion is thepreferred version.
Column Comment.11: PRESSURE: The reference pressure defined for standard gas volumes.
Column Comment.12: PRESSURE UOM: The units of measure for the standard pressure.
Column Comment.13: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.14: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.15: TEMPERATURE: The reference termperature defined for standard gas volumes.
Column Comment.16: TEMPERATURE UOM: The units of measure for the standard temperature.
Column Comment.17: TO UOM: The units of measure that the source data is will be converted to.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
